TopicTitle: Post your KSS (Space Station) pictures MEGATHREAD

Articles.Content:
Yeah, title says all. Just post a picutre of one or all of your space stations and give a small description. You can also post download links if youd like.

Kerbin International Space Station

Skylab

Has elements of the real (now de-orbited) Mir. Has room for 42 Kerbonauts and is crewed by fourteen.

K-OPSEK Orbital Station

Stands for Kerbin-Orbital Piloted Space Experimentation Komplex and is based off the proposed Russian OPSEK. Used as a transfer point for missions go to and from interplanetary space. Has room for 36 Kerbonauts and is crewed by 12.

Mun Interlunar Space Station

Basically the K-ISS's baby Mun-orbiting cousin. Used for transfers and refuels for craft bound for both the Mun and Minmus. Has room for 13 Kerbonauts and is crewed by 8.

___________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________

If youd like me to I'd be happy to post download links or more screens.
There already is another thread like this: http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/showthread.php/22251-Showcase-SPACE-STATIONS%21-Post-your-pictures-here

It's not really a replica, because there's no science power platform like you have. It was scheduled to go up in 2014-2015, but the program was cancelled because the Russian modules are now using the US solar arrays. You also have two extra modules on the front part. The top and bottom modules should not be there. The only modules connected to Node 2 are the ESA Columbus Lab and the Japanese Experiment Module. Still neat.
My first orbital refueling station the K.S.S Chevron. Still a work in progress but the main core of the station is done.
